4 charged with terror plot at JFK airport





Four men have been charged with conspiring to blow up jet fuel supply tanks
and pipelines at John F. Kennedy International Airport.





FULL STORY

Dozens injured when car plows into D.C. street festival





A woman plowed her car through a crowded street festival Saturday night,
injuring about 35 people, including two police officers who drove their motor
scooters into her path attempting to stop her, authorities said.

Storm brings needed rain





Tropical Storm Barry weakened into a tropical depression as it moved through
Tampa Bay on Saturday, bringing nearly 7 inches of rain to parts of the
drought-parched region.

'Monster pig' was a not-so-wild gift named Fred





The huge hog that became known as "Monster Pig" after being hunted and killed
by an 11-year-old boy had another name: Fred.

Report: TB patient maintains he is married





Rejecting earlier claims made by a local Greek official, tuberculosis patient
Andrew Speaker said he did marry his fiancee in a small Greek town during his
trans-Atlantic trip.

FDA: Throw away toothpaste made in China





The government warned consumers on Friday to avoid using toothpaste made in
China because it may contain a poisonous chemical used in antifreeze.

U.S. warns Turkey on border action





U.S. Defense Secretary Robert Gates on Sunday cautioned Turkey against sending
troops into northern Iraq, as it has threatened, to hunt down Kurdish rebels
it accuses of carrying out terrorist raids inside Turkey.

Castro on Cuban TV with Vietnamese official





For the first time in four months, Cuban leader Fidel Castro was shown
standing and talking in video footage that aired on state-run Cuban TV.

Iranian official: U.S. detainees sent to interfere in Tehran





The United States was using some of the four Iranian-Americans detained by
Tehran to meddle in Iranian affairs and is trying to cover it up, Tehran's
security chief charged Saturday.

Lebanon keeps up siege on militants in Palestinian camp





Six Lebanese soldiers were killed during intense fighting as the army battled
again Saturday to rout militants from a Palestinian refugee camp north of
Tripoli, a military spokesman said.

Surgery can fix back problems, but time works too





Surgery works for people with a slipped or misaligned disk, but often is not
necessary if patients can muster enough patience, according to two studies in
the New England Journal of Medicine.
